name: West Bond

trails_config.name: Zealand & Twinway to Bond Spur
trails_config.description: A remote out-and-back trek from Zealand Road: hike past Zealand Falls Hut and over Mount Guyot via the Twinway, then take the spur to West Bond’s small, rocky summit. West Bond offers a jaw-dropping perch with dramatic views of Bondcliff and the depths of the wilderness. Often combined with nearby Bonds for a legendary day.

current_conditions.ai_summary: Experience the beauty of New Hampshire on West Bond. At 4540 feet, this summit commands impressive views of the surrounding wilderness.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4540 feet, West Bond is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Zealand & Twinway to Bond Spur**, a **16.0 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Bond**, which is just 0.6 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
